lines.content: > "Your mind is for having ideas, not holding them." - David Allen ([source](https://dansilvestre.com/productivity-quotes))
BenPro frees your mind of having to remember things you need to do. It's,
All you need to do is,
4. let it manage your tasks for you :wink:
If you are a Java programmer, you can use it to practice Java too.

* Represents a command to mark a task as done in the task list.
* Creates a MarkCommand with the specified index to mark a task as done.
* @param index The index of the task to be marked as done.
* Executes the MarkCommand by marking the task at the specified index as done.
* @param tasks   The task list in which the task will be marked as done.
* @param ui      The user interface to display messages.
* @param storage The storage to save the updated task list.
* @throws BenException If an error occurs during the execution of the command.
public String execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws BenException {
// check if task list is empty
assert !tasks.isEmpty() : "There are no pending tasks now... Add some tasks here!";
// check if input is within bounds
assert !tasks.isOutOfBounds(index) : "Please input a valid number between 1 and " + tasks.size();
